channel.title: Projects on Nicholas Vietto
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Nicholas Vietto

item.title: Teaching
item.description: This page contains the teaching material for courses I have taught and developed. At the links below, you’ll find slides, assignments, and other resources. Feel free to use them. Research Methods This is an undergraduate criminology and criminal justice research methods course. The repository for course material can be found here. Statistics This is an undergraduate criminology and criminal justice applied statistics course. The repository for course material can be found here.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Below, you’ll find a list of my publications. While it’s on my to do list to make them accessible on an open-access platform, please don’t hesitate to reach out if you encounter a paywall and require a copy. I’m happy to help. Biopsychosocial Criminology Armstrong, T. A., Boisvert, D. L., Wells, J., Lewis, R. H., Cooke, E. M., Woeckener, M., Kavish, N., Vietto, N., & Harper, J. M. (2022). Testosterone, cortisol, and criminal behavior in men and women.

item.title: Data Visualizations
item.description: Tidy Tuesday is a weekly social data challenge in R, where participants use a new data set each week to create a data visualization and share their work on social media with #TidyTuesday. For more information on how to participate head here.

item.title: R Packages
item.description: These are some fun packages I’ve created for R users. nopunintended nopunintended is a package designed to take your mind off coding with puns from ‘No Pun Intended: Volume Too’ in the show/video game ‘The Last of Us’. Check it out here. movienight movienight is a package that recommend a film within RStudio. Check it out here.
